title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1211.73 - Ethylene imine, inhibited and propylene imine, inhibited
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1211.73 - Ethylene imine, inhibited and propylene imine, inhibited

State Regulations

Ethylene imine, inhibited and propylene imine, inhibited are restricted to a maximum quantity per vehicle* of 10 gallons or
100 pounds gross weight provided, however, such liquids are packed in wooden
boxes, with inside glass containers not exceeding 16 fluid ounces or one pound
each, in tightly closed metal cans, with not more than five pints of liquid
packed in each outside wooden box. There are no restrictions on the transport
of empty containers which last contained ethylene imine, inhibited or propylene
imine, inhibited provided the accompanying shipping papers show that they are
drained of the liquid and securely closed. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21

1211.73

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
